010package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * This class implements a x/y-separated 2D Gaussian filter by extending {@link LinearFilterSeparable}.
016 *
017 * @author WB
018 * @version 2020/12/29
019 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
020 * @see GaussianFilter
021 */
022public class GaussianFilterSeparable extends LinearFilterSeparable {
023        
024        /**
025         * Constructor accepting a common sigma for x/y.
026         * @param sigma the width of the 2D Gaussian in x- and y-direction
027         */
028        public GaussianFilterSeparable(double sigma) {
029                super(new GaussianKernel1D(sigma));
030        }
031
032        /**
033         * Constructor accepting individual sigmas for x/y. If any sigma &le; 0 or NaN, i.e., the corresponding x- or y-pass
034         * is not performed.
035         *
036         * @param sigmaX the width of the 2D Gaussian in x-direction
037         * @param sigmaY the width of the 2D Gaussian in y-direction
038         */
039        public GaussianFilterSeparable(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
040                super(makeKernel(sigmaX), makeKernel(sigmaY));
041        }
042        
043        private static GaussianKernel1D makeKernel(double sigma) {
044                if (Double.isFinite(sigma) && sigma > Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE) {
045                        return new GaussianKernel1D(sigma);
046                }
047                else {
048                        return null;
049                }
050        }
051        
052}
